pageContext.claim: “The caravan now, they're saying, is massive. The caravan that's coming up. Thank you very much, Honduras. We send Honduras hundreds of millions of dollars, and they send us caravans.”
pageContext.analysis: The new caravan appears to be about the size of previous caravans. News reports said 5,600 Central Americans were awaiting visas at Tecún Umán, on Guatemala’s border with Mexico, and a group of about 400 people left the Honduran city of San Pedro Sula a few days before this statement. The U.S. government gave Honduras just $30 million in aid in 2018.
